quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Life and Words
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, field, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: I was the 39th President of the US. My wifes name is Rosalyn. Who Am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Carter

questions.question: My father was also Commander in Chief. I served only one term as President. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Quincy Adams

questions.question: With the following words, this famous person describes to his brother Theo the passion he feels for his cousin Kee: Life has become very dear to me, and I am very glad that I love. My life and my love are one. But you are faced with a no, never never is your reply. My answer to that is, Old boy, for the present I look upon that no, never never as a block of ice which I press to my heart to thaw.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vincent Van Gogh

questions.question: Which famous person addressed the following words to his wife Clementine: Time passes swiftly, but is it not joyous to see how great and growing is the treasure we have gathered together, amid the storms and stresses of so many eventful and to millions tragic and terrible years??
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winston Churchill

questions.question: Which writer and philosopher wrote the following while he was in prison: I am a prisoner here in the name of the King; they can take my life, but not the love that I feel for you. Yes, my adorable mistress, to-night I shall see you, and if I had to put my head on the block to do it.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Voltaire

questions.question: This famous writer, author of Les Miserables, wrote the following words: ...You have been privileged to receive every gift from nature, you have both fortitude and tears. Oh, Adele, do not mistake these words for blind enthusiasm - enthusiasm for you has lasted all my life, and increased day by day. My whole soul is yours. If my entire existence had not been yours, the harmony of my being would have been lost, and I must have died -- died inevitably.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Victor Hugo

questions.question: Name the politician who wrote the following words: Beware, Josephine; one fine night the doors will be broken down and there I shall be. In truth, I am worried, my love, to have no news from you; write me a four page letter instantly made up from those delightful words which fill my heart with emotion and joy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Napoleon Bonaparte

questions.question: What do Hugh OConnor and Cleopatra VII have in common?

options.text: They both died at the age of 35.
They were both born in April.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They both committed suicide.

questions.question: Which famous poet wrote the following to his beloved Fanny Brawne: I cannot exist without you - I am forgetful of every thing but seeing you again - my life seems to stop there - I see no further. You have absorbd me.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Keats

questions.question: Which New Zealand-born author wrote the following: Do not imagine, because you find these lines in your journal that I have been trespassing.  You know I have not - and where else shall I leave a love letter? For I long to write you a love-letter tonight.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Katherine Mansfield

questions.question: In 1963 Patsy Cline killed her abusive husband and then turned the gun on herself.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 1998 we lost one of our greatest track and field competitors. Many people feel that she used steroids and that led to her early death.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Florence Griffith-Joyner

questions.question: Football star Derrick Thomas died in a shoot out outside a Kansas City club in 2000.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This German philosopher is the author of the book The Antichrist and also of this popular quote: You need chaos in your soul to give birth to a dancing star.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Friedrich Nietzsche

questions.question: Which US President addressed these words to his wife: ...Still this is the day, the day that marks 31 years of such happiness that has come to few me. I told you once that this was like adolescents dream of what marriage should be like. That hasnt changed.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Country and Nickname
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, englands, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which Mediterranean country is the most probable place of birth of a person named Pablo Diego José Francisco de Paula Juan Nepomuceno María de los Remedios Cipriano de la Santísima Trinidad Clito Ruiz?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spain

questions.question: I was the first President to be impeached and the first Vice President to become President due to assassination. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Johnson

questions.question: Formula 1 driver Kimi Raikonnen is called The Iceman. Judging by his surname, what northern country is he from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Finland

questions.question: Judging by his name, Kim Jong-il became the ruler of this axis of evil country in 1994.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North Korea

questions.question: I was the 7th President of the US. I got my nickname Old Hickory during the War of 1812, my troops said I was as rough as hickory wood. My wifes name was Rachel. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Jackson

questions.question: I was the first President to have been divorced. My first wifes name was Jane and my first ladys name was Nancy. I was born in Illinois in 1911. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ronald Reagan

questions.question: Zbigniew Brzezinski served as US National Security Advisor under President Jimmy Carter. Judging by his name, what was his native language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Polish

questions.question: Joe McNull was a star of .. the Polish national basketball team. His name suggests that he must have been born somewhere else. What basketball loving country is most likely his homeland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The USA

questions.question: I was responsible for the Louisiana Purchase and The Lewis and Clark Expedition. I also founded the University of Virginia. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: My nickname was Old Rough and Ready. I served just  sixteen months in office in 1849-1850. I was succeeded by Millard Fillmore. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zachary Taylor

questions.question: In 2007, Fabio Capello was appointed head coach of Englands national football team. His name tells that he is most likely from this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Italy

questions.question: Svetlana Kuznietzova and Maria Sharapova are top tennis players (and beauties as well). Judging by their surnames, what country are they from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Russia

questions.question: This actress was 54 when she died in May 1990 of breast cancer, a disease she battled for over six years. She was married to Charles Bronson at the time of her death.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jill Ireland

questions.question: Edvin van der Saar is famous as the goalie of Manchester United. What nationality is his name typical of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dutch

questions.question: Zlatan Ibrahimovic is a .. Swedish football player. He was born in Sweden to a family of immigrants. What country did his parents leave to move to Sweden?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Former Yugoslavia

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Helen Keller and Knight
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, college, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Neither Anne Sullivan nor Helen Keller ever married.  They lived together from the time Anne came to Helen as a child, until she died.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: On what date did Anne Sullivan and Helen Keller meet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: March 3, 1887

questions.question: What president awarded Helen Keller the Presidential Medal of Freedom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lyndon Johnson

questions.question: This incredibly talented African-American stand-up comedian turned his comic abilities into a successful movie career.  He was 65 when he died in December of 2005, after battling a crippling disease during the last several years of his life.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Pryor

questions.question: Kazuyoshi Funaki was a champion in ski-jumping. You dont have to be a ski-jumping expert to know that he represented this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Japan

questions.question: The young King Arthur pulled the sword Excalibur from a stone that proved the young Arthur would be the next king.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Miss World 2005 was Unnur Birna Vilhjalmsdottir. Judging by her last name, what country is she from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iceland

questions.question: When Helen Keller passed away, in what cathedral were her ashes placed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Washington National Cathedral.

questions.question: Which college did Helen Keller not attend?

options.text: The Cambridge School for Young Ladies

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvard College

questions.question: Which knight met the challenge of the The Green Knight?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir Gawain

questions.question: Frank Gorshin, the man of  100 faces, was best known as an impressionist.  He was often seen on The Dean Martin Celebrity Roasts and played this character on the TV series Batman.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Riddler

questions.question: Anne Sullivan lost her eyesight to what disease?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trachoma

questions.question: Did Lane Smith, who was cast member of My Cousin Vinny, ever play the role of a President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: This knight was known as the perfect knight  and was the only knight worthy to sit in the Siege Perilous. Which knight was the only one to succeed in the quest for the Holy Grail and free the Fisher King?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Galahad

questions.question: Naim Süleymanoğlu is a Bulgarian champion in weightlifting. What origin does his last name suggest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Turkish

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Office and U.s.
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, people, troops. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which two U.S. Presidents were the first father and son to hold the office?

options.text: William Henry Harrison and Benjamin Harrison
George H.W. Bush and George Bush
John Adams and John Quincy Adams
Theodore Roosevelt and Franklin D. Roosevelt

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Adams and John Quincy Adams

questions.question: Who was the first U.S. President to take office while unmarried?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: This future general  was educated at the expense of King Louis XVI, at Brienne and the École Militaire in Paris. He graduated in 1785, at the age of 16, and joined the artillery as a second lieutenant.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Napoleon Bonaparte

questions.question: According to Geoffrey of Monmouths History of the Kings of England, King Arthur was the King of which realm?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Britain

questions.question: Which U.S. President was the first to formally commit American military troops to the war between North and South Vietnam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John F. Kennedy

questions.question: Who was the first U.S. President to serve non-consecutive terms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grover Cleveland

questions.question: Under which U.S. President was the first atomic bomb developed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin D. Roosevelt

questions.question: At the age of 20 this future general was confident that he would  make an efficient adjutant (Major), though he was then without military experience. In November 1752 he was appointed adjutant of the southern district of Virginia by Governor Robert Dinwiddie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Washington

questions.question: Who was the first U.S. President to be impeached?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Johnson

questions.question: Which president was elected to two Presidential terms without ever getting a majority of the popular vote?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wiliam J. Clinton

questions.question: Who was the first U.S. President to die in office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Henry Harrison

questions.question: He voiced the adult flower in Bambi and Mr. Stork in Dumbo. He was also the voice of Kaa in Jungle book, of the Cheshire cat in Alice in Wonderland and of the original Honey Nut Bee on the Cheerios commercials. His face may be forgotten, his voice never will. On TV he had a lovable role as Uncle Oscar the inventor on The Adventures of Superman series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sterling Holloway

questions.question: Who is the first person to serve as both Vice President and President of the United States, without having been elected to either office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gerald R. Ford

questions.question: After Queen Guinevere is found in an adulterous love affair, King Arthur is forced to condemn her to burn at the stake. Who arrives to save Queen Guinevere?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lancelot

questions.question: Which U.S. President studied nuclear physics but made a career in politics and farming?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Carter

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Future General and General
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, leader, actor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: At the age of 14, this future general, born in Kefar Malal, Israel, joined the Haganah, an underground militia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ariel Sharon

questions.question: From 58 to 56 BC, this future general served as a leader of cavalry in Roman campaigns in Palestine and Egypt. He formed the Second Triumvirate, which ultimately secured the end of the Roman Republic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Antony

questions.question: This future general was educated at the United States Military Academy. When he graduated, the American Civil War was under way and he was assigned to the Union Army as a second lieutenant.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Custer

questions.question: This future general, born in San Gabriel, California, was educated at the U.S. Military Academy. On his graduation in 1909 he was commissioned a second lieutenant. He served in both World Wars and as a military Governor of Bavaria.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Patton

questions.question: Which American actor said: I told my psychiatrist that everyone hates me. He said I was being ridiculous - everyone hasnt met me yet.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jacob Cohen

questions.question: Which American actor delivered the words: Ive been accused of vulgarity. I say thats bullshit.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mel Brooks

questions.question: This future general joined the German army in 1910. After winning awards for bravery in World War I, he taught in military academies. Accusations of high treason drove him to suicide in 1944.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Erwin Rommel

questions.question: Which political figure said: If you want a thing done well, do it yourself.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Napoleon Bonaparte

questions.question: Which English historical figure said: I may be drunk, Miss, but in the morning I will be sober and you will still be ugly.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winston Churchill

questions.question: What German scientist said: The difference between genius and stupidity is that genius has its limits.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albert Einstein

questions.question: This future general, born in Tokyo, graduated from the Army Staff College at the top of his class in 1915. He served as a military attaché in Switzerland and Germany from 1919 to 1922.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tōjō Hideki

questions.question: At the age of nine this future general accompanied his father on the Carthaginian expedition to conquer Spain. Before starting, the boy vowed eternal hatred for Rome.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hannibal

questions.question: Which Indian pioneer of Satyagraha made the statement: Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mahatma Gandhi

questions.question: In 1829, this future general graduated second in his class from the U.S. Military Academy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert E. Lee

questions.question: What American writer said: Better to keep your mouth shut and appear stupid than to open it and remove all doubt.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Twain

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: U.s. and U.s. Presidential Couple
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, birds, john. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Harry and Bess were the members of which U.S. presidential family?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Trumans

questions.question: Who was U.S. President Abraham Lincolns wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary

questions.question: What was the last name of the U.S. presidential couple Gerry and Betty?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Fords

questions.question: Which of the following was the first name of U.S. presidential wife Mrs. Roosevelt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eleanor

questions.question: What were the first names of the U.S. presidential couple the Madisons?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James and Dolly

questions.question: Who was U.S. FIrst Lady Lady Birds husband?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lyndon Johnson

questions.question: Where does Iraq rank in the worlds supply of oil?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Second

questions.question: Saddam Hussein, President of Iraq from 1979 until his removal and capture by the United States in 2003, was officially born on what date?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: April 28, 1937

questions.question: What were the first names of the U.S. presidential couple the Jeffersons?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom and Martha

questions.question: What American novelist said: Nothing is as frustrating as arguing with someone who knows what hes talking about.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sam Ewing

questions.question: Saddam Hussein married Sajida Talfah in 1958.  How were they related before the marriage?

options.text: She was a friend from school

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She was his cousin

questions.question: What was the last name of U.S. presidential couple John and Abigail?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adams

questions.question: What novelist made the statement: So soon as a fashion is universal, it is out of date.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

questions.question: How was First Lady Mrs. Dwight Eisenhower affectionately known?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mamie

questions.question: Who was the first first lady, wife of George Washington?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martha
